programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon return to a town where they have always enjoyed good luck in the past - but this time, Dave is the one who comes out on top.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Customers offer the team some spooky artefacts during Halloween, including a 19th-century vampire-killing kit and a set of equipment used in paranormal investigations.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to get a good price on a fighter jet, as well as a baseball bat and glove signed by acclaimed player Babe Ruth.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a famous car featured in the James Bond movie The Spy who Loved Me.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron agrees to a controversial deal, and Rick restores a 1960s motorcycle.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie is delighted when he convinces veteran driver Scott to return to heavy rescue team, while a tough winter on the Coquihalla Highway pushes Adam to breaking point.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: A man who believes his skull is indestructible, a runner who can cover extraordinary distances in harsh conditions, and a person who claims to dream the future.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The 1993 murder of a Californian mother-of-two, revealing how detectives faced with multiple suspects, from her estranged husband and an obsessed colleague to a local serial killer. However, they finally cracked the case and brought a more unlikely culprit to justice.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams strip a Mini City and a Mini Cooper as they look to make the maximum profit from selling their spare parts.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites David O'Doherty, Rose Matafeo and Ed Gamble to help him make sense of the world.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Host Stephen Fry asks questions on cockneys, catfish and coal. Rory McGrath, Phill Jupitus, Bill Bailey and Alan Davies are the panellists trying to concoct interesting answers.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actors Kevin Bishop and Brian Blessed, comedian Josh Widdicombe and historian Kate Williams, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Rhod Gilbert, Jamie Laing, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Claudia Winkleman, who aim to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies are joined by Jimmy Carr, Gyles Brandreth and Sally Phillips, who answer questions on the subject of piecemeal, with points awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: The group continues searching for a new place to live, while the triangle between Todd, Gail and Melissa gets more complicated.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.sub-title: The Open-Ended Nature of Unwitnessed Deaths
programme.desc: Tandy wants to learn about Lewis's past, while Carol asks Gail a favour and Todd helps Melissa deal with her mental state.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: James is called to a man threatening to throw himself into a river, and Nadiene and Matt head out to a man with learning difficulties who is giving sheltered housing staff trouble.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In the heartland of beer, Frank is surprised to meet an old friend, and the guys secretly prepare a surprise build for Danielle.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Nat and John's day in Glasgow gets off to a flying start, but Dan's dirty tactics lead to mayhem within the team. Meanwhile, George finds himself with a new pet.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: The bidders head to Preston, where Dan's arrogant behaviour gets him into trouble once again. Presented by Sean Kelly.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys double-team a packed property to find what they are looking for before nightfall, and Mike discovers something living in the attic.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.sub-title: May The Ford Be with You
programme.desc: Mike and Frank attempt to unearth a rare vintage car, which could be worth a fortune.

programme.title: Jay Leno's Garage
programme.desc: Chat show legend Jay Leno and an array of guests explore the links between outer space and cars, and Jay gets an education in going fast and drives the Mars Rover.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond take charge of shooting a car chase for a film version of The Sweeney, assisting with the stunt-driving choreography and the direction of lead actors Ray Winstone and Ben Drew. James May takes the Vauxhall Corsa VXR Nurburgring for a run around the test track, and delivers his verdict on the updated Fiat Panda. Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May work on a project to build mobility scooters capable of tackling the British countryside's terrain, and actor Michael Fassbender is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car. Ferrari's four-wheel-drive FF is pitted against the revised, V8-engined Bentley Continental GT on a test track at the edge of the Arctic Circle, while James puts the Fisker Karma through its paces in Florida, and meets AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Beat creates a cosy cabin in Germany, Peter and Bryan Sr win a Guinness World Record with their log car, and Joel takes on a difficult build.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John Heussi rebuilds the force's beat car. Meanwhile, an old patrol car turns up in the Czech Republic.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May pay tribute to Saab, the Swedish car manufacturer that created several successful models since the late 1940s, but has now ceased production. Richard Hammond takes the passenger's seat in a Skoda rally car that races a rocket-propelled flying man, and actor Matt Smith gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car. Jeremy also shreds the tyres of the noisy Maserati GranTurismo MC Stradale and the 510bhp Mercedes-Benz C63 AMG Black Series.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May test the KTM X-Bow, the Morgan Three Wheeler and the Caterham R500 at Donington Park racing circuit, and Blur bassist Alex James is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car. Jeremy also creates his own version of the Battle of Britain using an aircraft-engined Bentley and a flame-spitting BMW.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, actor Tom Davis, actor and musician Shaun Ryder and comedian Henning Wehn, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by space scientist Maggie Aderin-Pocock, comedian Phil Wang, actor Jason Watkins and EastEnders star Adam Woodyatt, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Host Stephen Fry asks questions on cockneys, catfish and coal. Rory McGrath, Phill Jupitus, Bill Bailey and Alan Davies are the panellists trying to concoct interesting answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Sara Pascoe and Johnny Vegas and former MP Ed Balls join regular panellist Alan Davies. to answer questions about subjects associated with various parts.

programme.title: Jon Richardson: Ultimate Worrier
programme.desc: Jon is joined by Lucy Beaumont, Angela Barnes and Jamali Maddix to address worries to do with consumerism. Is the High Street dead? Why aren't people recycling?.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Comedians Desiree Burch, Chris Ramsey and Lost Voice Guy are given the titles of real lectures and invited to give their own version. Presented by Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks questions on chihuahuas, cheese and constellations. Panellists Jeremy Clarkson, Rich Hall, Sean Lock and Alan Davies attempt to concoct interesting answers.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the South Devon Railway, Andy Leech and Liz Turner host afternoon tea for 44 passengers. In East Lancashire, volunteer Chandra Law takes on the new role of Stationmaster.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Hitler's Miracle Weapons
programme.desc: Unusual weapons created by German scientists during the Second World War, including giant cannons, V2 rockets and a 200-ton tank, and how they influenced future arms developments.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The skeleton dubbed the Warrior of Janakkala, found in Finland. The swords buried alongside the man suggest a link between Christians and Pagans and it has been deduced the remains date from the 12th century.

programme.title: Hitler v Churchill: The Eagle and the Lion
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring the rivalry between the leaders of Britain and Germany during the Second World War, and their common experiences during the First World War.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to the Roman legionary fort of Caerleon, in Gwent, where they investigate evidence that a huge structure - a courtyard surrounded by stone buildings - once led from the fort down to the River Usk. Archaeologists from Cardiff University help shed new light on what was once seen solely as a military outpost.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Somerset, where a family of farmers hopes to unearth evidence of a Norman castle believed to have once stood on top of what is known locally as Castle Hill. Records show there used to be such a structure in the area, but there are several likely locations for it. As the dig progresses, an outline of what appears to be a castle keep is revealed, but the findings lead to an unexpected conclusion.

programme.title: Hitler's England
programme.desc: Former Bergerac star John Nettles returns to Jersey to tell the story of the British Channel Islands under German occupation from 1940 to 1945.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Somerset, where a family of farmers hopes to unearth evidence of a Norman castle believed to have once stood on top of what is known locally as Castle Hill. Records show there used to be such a structure in the area, but there are several likely locations for it. As the dig progresses, an outline of what appears to be a castle keep is revealed, but the findings lead to an unexpected conclusion.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attend questions why spirals are so widespread in nature. He gleans some answers by examining the narwhal's tusk and the spiral shells found on snails and ammonites, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines a zebra's stripes and the wings of a butterfly, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at vibrantly coloured monkeys in Venezuela, Costa Rica and West Africa. He encounters the red howler, which boasts one of the loudest calls in the wild, a capuchin that uses a tree as an anvil, the guenon, which communicates via facial expression, and the ground-dwelling gelada baboon.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Three Gorges Dam, built across China's Yangtze river, which is the largest and heaviest concrete structure ever built, housing the world's largest power station.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Hitler's England
programme.desc: Former Bergerac star John Nettles returns to Jersey to tell the story of the British Channel Islands under German occupation from 1940 to 1945.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The drive to make trains faster, from supersonic rocket sleds to engines that seem to fly above their guideways.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at Sweden's passion for subterranean spaces and how this nation has taken extraordinary precautions to protect itself - by excavating an astounding 65,000 nuclear bunkers. In south-west England, deep in the Mendip Hills of Somerset, lies one of the most spectacular landscapes in the UK, but beneath this breath-taking landscape sits secret caverns and magical rock formations carved out by nature. Plus, how in Romania, nside a 1.2km-thick layer of salt, sits a world underground first.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Three Gorges Dam, built across China's Yangtze river, which is the largest and heaviest concrete structure ever built, housing the world's largest power station.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki and Jack travel to Scotland to examine the body of a lap dancer found in a remote forest, and the search for a suspect brings them into conflict with a couple of rogue city cops. However, when more remains are discovered, it becomes clear they are looking for a serial killer - and news of the crimes preys deeply on the mind of a young mother who is harbouring a dark secret. Emilia Fox and David Caves star, with appearances from Martin Compston (Line of Duty) and Gary Lewis (Billy Elliot).

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Australian drama about a hedonistic heart surgeon, Dr Hugh Knight, who is forced to work as a rural GP in his hometown of Whyhope. Starring Rodger Corser.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh receives a shocking introduction to Outback medicine when he attends a farm accident. Drama, starring Rodger Corser.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice leaves Jack and moves in with Evie, while the General Strike threatens the future of the new collection. Starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy has to adjust to life on his own when Nancy refuses to join him in Germany, and a misguided accusation results in events which could lead to the end of his career.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Major Radley decides to stage an escape and evasion exercise. Meanwhile, Bernie Roberts is faced with a crisis. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane faces a personal crisis that jeopardises her relationship with Owen, when her sister Joanna is rushed to the ward following a car crash. Ric has to deal with the repercussions of his night with Connie, while Will is frustrated by her constant criticism, and Donna gets caught in possession of drugs.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Struggling to come to terms with Conor's revelation about his sexuality, Sheelagh tries to build bridges with him - only to be floored by another shocking discovery. Irene Radford is implicated in an arson attack on an ice cream van, but it seems she will escape justice yet again when the van owner dies in suspicious circumstances. Jack angrily dismisses Debbie's concerns about his relationship with Rachel, but she refuses to take a hint and arranges a set-up to catch her out.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As Rob and Ken set out on the trail of warring factions the Hambilton Massive and Copthorne Crew, Kerry accepts a risky undercover assignment in a bid to help them nail local crime family the Radfords. Ramani returns to CSU and is appalled by the way Phil Hunter has handled things in her absence, while Rachel exacts a violent revenge on Martin Grainger, convinced he was responsible for telling Jack about her continuing involvement in the vice trade.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: It's the fifth of November and there are unexpected visitors at the local firework display.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Why are Frank and Arthur not sleeping in their own beds?.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A construction worker is injured by a colleague who has run amok with his excavator. A woman starts vomiting blood in the middle of a sales presentation, while a blind woman learns her condition can be rectified. Elsewhere, Baz decides to confess to her husband the details of her affair with Charlie.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer's teenage daughter goes missing, while an MP's son develops a profitable sideline in forged paintings. Drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A fatality interrupts the filming of a TV commercial. Jim tries to discover whether the death of a stuntman who crashed his hang-glider into the sea was accidental. Drama, guest starring Richard Griffiths.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell reports Freddie's disappearance - as Jack and Leonora discover that somebody else is looking for him.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Captain Peacock is far from happy when he realises that the head of the sports department has spread the news about a painful boil on his bottom - and eventually defends his honour in a boxing match. Comedy, starring Frank Thornton.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Judith suddenly becomes impressed by Lionel, while Alistair tries to woo Jean with a band and a gorillagram. Comedy, starring Judi Dench.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lionel has a habit of being unpredictable, but when he walks off and abandons his wife while out on a drive in the hills, it is left to Clegg, Truly and Billy to console her. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Roy Hudd guest stars.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch and Brackenreid send Crabtree undercover at a chess tournament to unravel the murder of a Russian master.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest's priceless Blue Cross is targeted by infamous criminal Flambeau, so taking matters into his own hands Father Brown sets out to try to save the thief's soul, but risks falling into a trap. Mystery, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra and the team investigate why five years earlier a man seemingly vanished during his morning run and has not been seen since. The alarm was raised when he never made it to work at the construction company belonging to his father-in-law, who has a history of violence, and the detectives' suspicions grow when they realise how much the missing man's wife is scared of her dad. Could he have had something to do with his son-in-law's disappearance? Amanda Redman, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A homeless man opens an abandoned suitcase in a park, only to find the body of a teenage girl inside. Jack and Nikki attend the scene with DS Sally Kirchner and are shocked to discover the victim's baby has been cut from her womb. From the placenta they are able to identify the father - but the married man in question denies any knowledge of the deceased. Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern star in the forensic crime drama, with guest appearances by Morven Christie and Sean Gallagher.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with members of Westminster, topical guests and cultural figures. With updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key-players throughout the programme.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Killer from the Abyss - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jeremy Wade takes on the biggest investigation of his career - to unravel what happened to the passengers of the RMS Laconia in the Atlantic.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news, entertainment and lifestyle features. Martin and Shirlie Kemp talks about their new album In the Swing of It, which marks the first time the couple have worked together, having both enjoyed individual chart success, in Spandau Ballet and Pepsi and Shirlie. The pair talk about their new work and their children's careers.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the dealers are in Warwick, where Stewart Hofgartner makes his oddest purchase yet, and Fay Rutter and Henry Nicholls both bid for paintings.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz in which players can accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice. Hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aaron steps up his campaign, Jai is intent on making Jimmy pay, and Andrea puts on a front.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: The average UK household spends an extra £800 during December. But as millions of shoppers are preparing for the festive season, so too are criminals with a whole range of fakes, cons and scams. Adam Shaw investigates how people can get the best value gifts and keep their money safe this Christmas.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aaron's anger gets out of control, Billy and Al square up to each other, and Leyla feels a pang of jealousy.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo begins this week in the Italian food capital of Bologna, where he picks up a snack for his journey - the Bolognese classic panino with mortadella. He then boards the train and heads towards the rice growing region of Mantova, where he helps out in the paddies and makes a chocolate rice pudding. He then visits Verona, home of one of the country's oldest art schools. Here he models for the students in their life-drawing class before serving up meatballs in tomato sauce for the young artists.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.sub-title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here! Coming Out
programme.desc: Just a few days after the new King or Queen of the jungle was crowned, Ant and Dec present the usual round-up of what happened behind the scenes as each campmate was voted out. From the first to the last, the programme reveals what they get up to in their first few days of freedom, and captures their reactions to old rivals and trusted friends, while their families gather for emotional reunions with their loved ones.

programme.title: Election 2019 Live: The Results
programme.desc: As the polls close, Bernard Ponsonby anchors STV's live through-the-night coverage of the battle for Number 10, beginning with the results of a UK-wide exit poll. Correspondents report from the key Scottish seats as the shape of the new parliament unfolds, and viewers will also be brought important declarations and developments from other parts of the UK, with interviews and reaction from senior politicians and expert analysts.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer gets a good deal on a 1957 Chevrolet and Edd China performs an excellent restoration job, but their colour choice could prove to be an expensive mistake.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes a 1941 Lincoln, a 1929 Pierce-Arrow and a Panhard to auction and bids on a Rolls Royce Phantom 3 for a client.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes his client's rare 1908 Simplex Speedcar roadster to an auction to see what kind of money it will make.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A motorcycle without brakes crashes into a crowd, and nine gallons of chemicals suddenly burst into flames. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Ron Pitts presents footage of diners being hit by a tornado and bus crashes.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: A storm forces the crew to fight rising water levels, while Bobby moves back to the 421 pine site and feller operator Simitrio informs the company of a trip to Mexico.

programme.title: Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Action from day three at Emirates Arena in Glasgow.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Missing
programme.desc: Terry O'Quinn explains how new technology could unveil lost cities in hostile jungles, paving the way for the truth to dispel myths about the legendary El Dorado.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League. including Wigan Athletic v West Bromwich Albion and Swansea City v Blackburn Rovers.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove are near Preston, visiting a collector of military gear and Americana. Much to their surprise they spot something a little unusual.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: In Lancashire, Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove explore a garage packed with hundreds of treasures and trinkets. They encounter various military vehicles and a lovely old petrol pump.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: After purchasing a badly modified DeSoto Firedome, Mike Brewer and Edd China set about addressing the damage to give the stunning cruiser back some of its class.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys an old Lancia Delta Integrale, enlisting Edd China to fix the brakes and change the battery.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes his work on the Lancia Delta Integrale, and Mike Brewer has no trouble in finding an eager buyer for the newly restored classic car.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes his three Ferraris, a 1971 Daytona Coupe and a 1972 Dino GT to the Amelia Island auction.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Smart city car the Fiat Panda is also a surprisingly good off-road hack. Mike Brewer tracks down a 4x4 model with potential, passing the vehicle on to mechanic Edd China, as the pair try to turn a profit improving its credentials before selling it on.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day four of the ranking tournament at Emirates Arena in Glasgow, featuring matches in the third round.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Eerie Eruption, Slippery Slope, Downstream Disaster
programme.desc: Footage of everything from human endurance and survival to calamitous engineering failures.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Boiling Bus, Lethal Landslide, Risky Rescue
programme.desc: Footage of near disasters, featuring a bus full of passengers flooding with water, a kayaker trapped inside a waterfall and travellers being swallowed by a landslide.

programme.title: Autobahn
programme.desc: A look at the Bundesautobahn 2 in Germany, one of Europe's busiest, most dangerous and most important highways. For many people it's their place of work, and many more use it to travel across Europe.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer gets a good deal on a 1957 Chevrolet and Edd China performs an excellent restoration job, but their colour choice could prove to be an expensive mistake.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: With partner Dan stuck at home, Justin starts the new mining season alone. He is dealt a huge blow as he discovers their rich underground mine has been pegged by another miner.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard makes a startling find at a 13th-century house in the Lake District. Later, he visits a classic car collector in Hertfordshire.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage Hunters' Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland embark on an epic motoring mission as the pair scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars. The duo spot a classic Golf GTI at a film props company and, at a barn in Suffolk, Drew unearths an early 1970s Lotus Elan that needs radical restoration.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Bill is asked to convert a '61 Cadillac. The guys fit a custom interior, suspension, wheels and tyres. Plus, a '63 C-10 gets its twin turbo engine fired up.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How stuntmen survive a bad day at work, the mining of amber gemstones and the production of fizzy cola drinks.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The supply of quality steaks to New York City, the making of surround-sound home cinema systems and the production and testing of tennis balls.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Katie's house, relationships and financial situation are in tatters. Feeling down and out, she recruits the help of an unlikely duo in her exes, Kris and Kieran.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Experts determine whether a lethal gunshot wound was self-inflicted by testing the weapon found beside the corpse.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Keith Reed, who was gunned down on his doorstep. A possible crime of passion was placed in doubt after a surprise discovery, with CCTV footage being called upon to unravel the mystery.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Timothy Moore, whose body was found in a shallow grave in April 2011, five months after he had been reported missing from his home in Washington's Willapa Bay. His son Devon later pleaded guilty to his murder.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Safe Streets Task Force monitor the violent acts of a notorious gang of hoodlums who have acquired a reputation for antisocial behaviour.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: When a kitten is trapped and in desperate need of help, emergency animal medical technician Traci Pepper faces her fears and risks her own life to save it.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Vet Lisa treats a cat badly injured in a hit-and-run, Chris devises a radical treatment for a bird and Pearl the blind seal undergoes a risky operation to restore her sight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride is more concerned with pleasing her mother than herself, while another customer has no idea what style of dress she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Devon visits Kleinfeld's with her fiance, NFL star Duane Brown, while Taya comes in with former American football player Adam Koets.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer faces a challenging fitting, and another bride disagrees with her mother about how her dress should look.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Australian vet Chris Brown assists a hit-and-run victim and a lorikeet learning to fly. Plus, a bichon frise gets into trouble after being bitten by a deadly snake.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Australian vet Chris Brown treats a sick kitten and travels to the bush to assist with a difficult birth. Plus, a loyal Labrador is in trouble after being hit by a car.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Twelve investigators have police back-up on a dangerous assignment to arrest a dog breeder selling sick puppies.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Officers from the Pennsylvania SPCA respond to a call concerning abandoned animals, but are unprepared for what they discover inside a fridge.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A leather jacket, a bird cage, a Japanese instrument and some fabric from south-east Asia are all in line for a make-over as Sarah Moore and Jay Blades save them from the homes of TV personality and celebrity chef Rustie Lee and former newsreader Jan Leeming. Narrated by Arthur Smith.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How arson investigators gather physical evidence and mount undercover and sting operations to crack insurance torchings and instances of murder.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 45-year-old blues guitarist John Spira who vanished in February 2007, the day he had finalised his divorce. The investigation went cold, until a series of events thrust it back into the limelight.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Michelle McMullen, whose car was found abandoned in September 2008. Pennsylvania investigators set about determining whether she was abducted or on the run, as $2,000 was found to have been stolen from the Susquehanna township church where she worked.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Mamas and Dramas and Tears, Oh My!
programme.desc: Lori and her team encounter some of their biggest conflicts yet, including a Nascar bride in distress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: The team helps a bride who has tried on 150 dresses, another who already owns two wedding gowns, and one who sets the record for the longest appointment yet.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori reaches her limit with the most disrespectful bridesmaids she has ever met, including some who try to put the bride off her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: When E'terica's fiance questions her taste in wedding gowns, he also tests her self-esteem, while Katy's mother is not ready to let go of her daughter.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride and her sister disagree about the bridesmaids wearing a form-fitting dress, while another battles with her mother about necklines.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bridesmaid searching for a husband threatens to leave the bridal party is she is not able to show off her body in a short dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A visitor to the shop is on the verge of a panic attack, and a bride needs to find a dress that all her university friends can agree on.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer wants to look like Cinderella and get married at Disneyland, and a bride buys a dress, but then worries she has made the wrong choice.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Staffordshire, modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard gains access to a private collection of a pub owner, who has been hoarding antiques for over half a century.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore rescues an old chimney pot, a wooden chest and a discarded bed, items that she and two other recycling experts restore before she tries to sell them for a profit.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Destinee never felt like she fit in, as she was born Matthew. She has come out as a transgender woman, but needs to lose some of her 600 pound-weight, so she can fully transition.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The case of John Tanner, who took part in a police reconstruction when his fiancee vanished. Plus, Paul Dyson whose TV plea for his missing lover raised suspicions. Series examining the phenomenon of criminal cases where people publically feign innocence about a crime they have committed, shedding crocodile tears in the process..

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of serial killer Bobby Joe Long reveal how his shocking crimes impacted the family. Were there any signs of his murderous intentions?.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: Detectives, friends and family reveal the twists and turns that led to tragedy, and where it all went wrong - revealing the 10 steps to murder.
